ranges.notes: Public holiday, many businesses closed. Winter sales (saldi) begin.
Winter season, fewer tourists. Good time for museums and indoor activities with shorter lines.
Public holiday marking the end of Christmas festivities. Last day for Christmas markets and decorations.
Excellent shopping discounts throughout the month. Very quiet tourism period. Indoor activities recommended due to cold temperatures.
Continued winter season. Quiet in the city with few tourists. Good time for indoor cultural activities.

ranges.event: Valentine's Day & Verona in Love Festival
ranges.notes: Special events throughout the city celebrating Romeo and Juliet's city. Red heart decorations, romantic markets, and special menus at restaurants.
Various Carnival celebrations, including the historic 'Bacanàl del Gnoco' parade. Last weeks of winter sales.
Early spring with gradually warming temperatures. Tourist numbers begin to increase. Gardens starting to bloom.
Traditional pastries (frittelle and zeppole) available in bakeries. Father's Day in Italy.
Spring officially begins. Giardino Giusti and other green spaces becoming more colorful. Easter preparations if it falls in March.

ranges.event: Holy Week & Easter (Settimana Santa - variable dates)
ranges.notes: Religious processions and events. Churches beautifully decorated. Many visitors if Easter falls during this period.
One of the world's largest wine exhibitions. The city becomes extremely busy with wine professionals and enthusiasts. Book accommodations well in advance.
Pleasant spring weather. Ideal time for sightseeing before summer crowds arrive.
National holiday with parades and commemorations. Many museums free.
Excellent spring weather. Gardens in full bloom. Tourist season picking up.
Public holiday, many shops closed but outdoor areas and piazzas busy. Concerts and events.
Perfect spring weather, warm but not hot. Outdoor cafes and restaurants full. Ideal time for exploring the city and surrounding countryside before peak season.
Beginning of summer. High season for tourism starts. Warm, pleasant days and evenings.
National holiday with military parades and celebrations.

ranges.event: Arena di Verona Opera Festival (opening season)
ranges.notes: The famous opera festival begins in the ancient Roman amphitheater. Spectacular productions under the stars. Book tickets well in advance.

ranges.event: Arena di Verona Opera Festival (peak season)
ranges.notes: Peak summer season. Hot days but pleasant evenings ideal for open-air opera. The city is very busy, especially on performance nights. Many cultural events and outdoor concerts throughout the city.
Hottest month. Very crowded with international tourists. Some local businesses may close for vacation. Early mornings and evenings best for sightseeing.
Major national holiday. Many restaurants and shops close. Very crowded at Lake Garda.
Continued high temperatures and tourism. Opera festival continues through early September. Many Italians on vacation, especially at nearby Lake Garda.

ranges.event: Arena di Verona Opera Festival (closing weeks)
ranges.notes: Final opera performances of the season. Still busy but temperatures becoming more pleasant.
International festival celebrating traditional games and sports from around the world. Historic center transforms into a playground with demonstrations and competitions.
Excellent weather, warm days and cooler evenings. Grape harvest in nearby Valpolicella wine region. Tourism begins to decrease slightly from summer peak.
Beautiful autumn colors, pleasant temperatures. Excellent for sightseeing and wine tourism (Amarone grape drying season). Cultural season begins at Teatro Filarmonico.
Public holiday, some closures. Traditional cemetery visits.
Low tourist season begins. Cooler weather but still pleasant for sightseeing. Theater and concert season in full swing.
German-style Christmas markets begin to open in Piazza dei Signori and surrounding streets.
Festive atmosphere builds with Christmas markets, decorations and holiday shopping.
Public holiday, official Christmas season start. International Nativity Scene Exhibition begins in the Arena.
Markets in Piazza dei Signori and other squares. Festive atmosphere throughout the city. Holiday shopping period.
Family time, many closures on 25th. Midnight Mass options, particularly impressive at San Zeno Basilica.
Public holiday, continued closures, quiet day.
Period between Christmas and New Year. Winter activities, museum visits, and festive shopping.
Public celebrations in Piazza Bra near the Arena. Restaurants offer special dinners (book well in advance).

summer: Wine Tasting (cooler cellars during hot days)
autumn: Autumn Colors in City Parks & Countryside
Day Trips to Valpolicella Wine Region
winter: Winter Opera Season at Teatro Filarmonico
Hot Chocolate & Pastry Tasting in Historic Cafés
Day Trips to Lessinia Mountains (snow activities)

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Ideal conditions, comfortable weather, special events, beautiful scenery, generally manageable crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Favorable conditions, good weather, interesting events, moderate tourism levels
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, potentially hot (summer) or cold (winter), notable crowds during peak season or major holidays
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, extreme temperatures, or overwhelming tourism (rarely applicable to Verona)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Generally unfavorable conditions for typical tourism (extremely rare for Verona)
